articles.author: JEFF AMY and JEFF MARTIN
articles.description: WINDER, Ga. (AP) — The 14-year-old boy accused of fatally shooting four people at a Georgia high school was expected to make his first court appearance Friday, a day after his father was also arrested for allowing his son to possess a weapon.
articles.title: First court appearance set for Georgia teen accused of killing 4 at his high school

articles.author: BY JEFF AMY
articles.description: WINDER, Ga. (AP) — It was the middle of second period on Wednesday morning at Apalachee High School, and the boy who few knew slipped out of his algebra class in J Hall again.
articles.title: Inside the Georgia high school where a sleepy morning was pierced by gunfire

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER, ALANNA DURKIN RICHER and MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The federal election interference case against Donald Trump inched forward Thursday, with a judge permitting prosecutors to file court documents later this month that could detail unflattering allegations about the former president as the Republican nominee enters the final weeks of his White House run.
articles.title: Prosecutors in Trump election case get judge's OK to lay out fresh evidence in court filing

articles.author: DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Russia has long sought to inject disinformation into U.S. political discourse. Now, it's got a new angle: paying Americans to do the work.This week's indictment of two Russian state media employees on charges that they paid a Tennessee company to create pro-Russian content has renewed concerns about foreign meddling in the November election while revealing the Kremlin's latest tactic in a growing information war.
articles.title: American company, Russian propaganda: New Kremlin tactic reveals escalating effort to sway US vote

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu were sharply at odds Thursday over prospects of reaching a deal for a Gaza cease-fire and hostage release, with Netanyahu saying it was “exactly inaccurate” that a breakthrough was close.
articles.title: Netanyahu gives a starkly different take on Biden administration's hopes for a Gaza deal

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD and EDNA TARIGAN
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — Pope Francis wrapped up his visit to Indonesia on Friday after celebrating Mass before an overflow crowd of 100,000, a final celebration before heading to Papua New Guinea for the second leg of his 11-day journey through Southeast Asia and Oceania.
articles.title: Pope heads to Papua New Guinea after final Mass in Indonesia before an overflow crowd of 100,000

articles.author: EVELYNE MUSAMBI
articles.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — A fire in a school dormitory in Kenya killed 17 students and seriously burned 13 others, police said Friday.There are fears that the death toll may rise, police said.The cause of the fire Thursday night at Hillside Endarasha Primary in Nyeri county was being investigated, police spokesperson Resila Onyango said.
articles.title: A fire in a school in Kenya has killed 17 students and seriously burned 13 others, police say

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Friday's monthly jobs report will likely mark a pivotal moment for the economy and the Federal Reserve.
articles.title: Jobs report will help Federal Reserve decide how much to cut interest rates

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — It could be a well-rehearsed zinger, a too-loud sigh — or a full performance befuddled enough to shockingly end a sitting president's reelection bid.
articles.title: From stirring to cringey: Memorable moments from past presidential debates

articles.author: DAVE SKRETTA
articles.description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) — Patrick Mahomes thought for a moment that the Chiefs were headed to overtime. So did Ravens counterpart Lamar Jackson, who had found Isaiah Likely in the back of the end zone with no time left for a touchdown that appeared to tie the game.
articles.title: Chiefs hold off Ravens 27-20 when review overturns TD on final play of NFL's season opener
